Description: Group of 3 sherds: 2 bodies and one reworked sherd from hand-made pottery vessels. The body decoration on all of them is rocker packed dotted zigzag, type R1. The fabric is high grade mineral tempered, type III. Ware Group A. One has been re-worked into a disk shaped tool.
Curator's comments: References for typology: Gatto, M.C.2006, The Khartoum Variant Pottery in Context: rethinking the Early and Middle Holocene Nubian Sequence, Archeologie du Nil Moyen 10; Gatto, M.C. 2002, Early Neolithic Pottery of the Nabta-Kiseiba Area: Stylisitic Attributes and Regional Relationships, in K. Nelson 2002, Holocene Settlement of the Egyptian Sahara, vol. 2, the Pottery of Nabta Playa: 65-78.
Bibliographic references: Nelson, Schild & Wendorf 2002 / Holocene Settlement of the Egyptian Sahara, Vol. 2 The Pottery of Nabta Playa (fig. 3.3 b,c,d)
